actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Mr. Bachus moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5010.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 377 - 6 (Roll no. 478).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: To provide for a circulating quarter dollar coin program to commemorate the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes.
short_title: District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act

summary.text: District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act - Amends Federal monetary law to mandate that quarter dollar coins issued beginning in 2009 have designs on the reverse side emblematic of the District of Columbia and the territories: (1) the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico; (2) Guam; (3) American Samoa; (4) the U.S. Virgin Islands; and (5) the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. Prescribes implementation guidelines.

titles.title: District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act
District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act

To provide for a circulating quarter dollar coin program to commemorate the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the United States Virgin Islands, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and for other purposes.
